senses.de: Things that happen often and at the same time
senses.ex: She goes to the gym on a regular basis.

Tips.title: Routine Events
Tips.description: Used to describe actions that occur at specific, unchanging intervals, like habits.
Tips.example: The meetings are held at regular intervals.

Tips.title: Fixed Schedule
Tips.description: Indicates something is part of a set schedule and not random.
Tips.example: She takes her medication at regular times every day.

senses.ex: He is just a regular guy.

Tips.title: Colloquial Usage
Tips.description: Often used in everyday conversation to describe someone or something familiar.
Tips.example: We had a regular meal, nothing fancy.

Tips.title: Ordinary People
Tips.description: Refers to people without special rank, position, or distinction in society.
Tips.example: Despite his fame, he likes to be seen as a regular person.

senses.de: Having an even and symmetrical shape or structure
senses.ex: The house has a regular geometric shape.

Tips.title: Geometric Consistency
Tips.description: Emphasizes uniformity in shapes and structures, often in math or art.
Tips.example: She prefers clothes with regular patterns.

Tips.title: Symmetry Emphasis
Tips.description: Highlights the balance and proportion in design or arrangement.
Tips.example: The garden was laid out in a regular design for simplicity.

senses.de: A person who often goes to the same place
senses.ex: He's a regular at the local pub.

Tips.title: Patronage Frequency
Tips.description: Suggests a high frequency of visits to a place, showing loyalty or habit.
Tips.example: She's become a regular at our coffee shop.

senses.ex: There is a regular beat in the song.

Tips.title: Patterned Rhythm
Tips.description: Refers to a consistent and identifiable pattern in music, poetry, or dance.
Tips.example: Drummers must maintain a regular rhythm for the band.

Common.wordDefinition:
Common means something that is widely found, seen or experienced by many people. For example, it is common to see people using smartphones these days.

Common refers to something that is normal or widespread, while regular refers to something that happens frequently or consistently.

Normal.wordDefinition:
The words normal and regular are similar in meaning but the subtle difference is that normal refers to what is expected or typical within a certain range, while regular refers to something happening consistently or at equal intervals of time.

For example, a person's height could be considered normal for their age, gender and genetics. A person who goes to the gym every Monday, Wednesday and Friday can be said to have a regular exercise routine.

Normal is typically used to talk about what is considered average or standard, while regular describes something that happens frequently or consistently.

Ordinary.wordDefinition:
Ordinary means something that is normal or typical. For example, an ordinary day might consist of waking up, going to school or work, and coming home.

So, while both words are similar in meaning, ordinary refers to the typical or common, while regular refers to something that happens consistently or frequently.

Routine.wordDefinition:
Regular refers to something that happens frequently or consistently, usually on a set schedule. For example, if you go to the gym every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, that is a regular exercise routine.

Routine refers to a sequence of actions that you frequently perform in a particular order. For example, your morning routine might include showering, brushing your teeth, and getting dressed before you go to school.

So while they are similar in some ways, regular relates more to frequency and timing, while routine relates more to the sequence of actions.

Standardize.wordDefinition:
Standardize refers to making something consistent or uniform. This can be applied to many things, such as manufacturing products to meet specific specifications or setting standardized tests for students.

Regular means normal or common, while standardize means to make something consistent or uniform.

Traditional.wordDefinition:
Traditional refers to something that is related to the customs or beliefs of a particular culture or group. It is applicable when talking about things that have been practiced for a long time and have a strong cultural or historical association.

For example, a regular day would be a typical day that one would expect to happen, whereas a traditional day would be a day where certain cultural or religious customs are observed.

A regular sandwich would be a typical sandwich, whereas a traditional sandwich would be one that is made using a particular recipe that is unique to a certain culture or region.

Typical.wordDefinition:
Typical refers to something that is commonly seen or expected, based on past experiences or general knowledge.

Regular describes the frequency or pattern of something while typical describes the general expectation or norm. So, for example, a person's regular exercise routine might involve running three times a week, while it is typical for students to take exams at the end of each semester.

Usual.wordDefinition:
Usual, on the other hand, means something that is common or familiar. It refers to something that is typical or expected in a particular situation, such as it being usual to have a cup of coffee in the morning.

The word regular refers to something that happens frequently or routinely, while the word usual refers to something that is commonplace or expected in a particular situation.

quotes.Text: My friend asked me if I wanted a frozen banana. I said 'No, but I want a regular banana later, so... yeah.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Mitch Hedberg

quotes.Text: I'm just a regular person who believes life is simple, and I like a simple life.
quotes.Title: Filipino Boxer
quotes.Name: Manny Pacquiao

quotes.Text: The most important thing for me is that I get regular first team action.

quotes.Name: Toni Kroos

quotes.Text: In regular life, I'm somebody pretty simple, pretty calm.

quotes.Text: My mom always made sure I lived my life as a regular kid.

quotes.Text: The world doesn't realise I have a regular job!

quotes.Text: I was a regular kid with a normal family life.

quotes.Text: I'm always preparing for a regular life.

quotes.Text: I have a regular, normal private life.
